Questions.qstn: A certain game board is in the shape of a non-convex polygon, with spokes that extend from each vertex to the center of the board.  If each spoke is 8 inches long, and spokes are used nowhere else on the board, what is the sum of the interior angles of the polygon?
Questions.qstnStmt1: (1)  The sum of the exterior angles of the polygon is 360º (360 degrees).
Questions.qstnStmt2: (2)  The sum of the exterior angles is equal to five times the total length of all of the spokes used.
Questions.opt1: Statement (1) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (2) alone is not sufficient to answer the question asked.
Questions.opt2: Statement (2) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (1) alone is not sufficient to answer the question asked.
Questions.opt3: BOTH statements (1) and (2) TOGETHER are sufficient to answer the question asked, but NEITHER statement ALONE is sufficient.
Questions.opt4: EACH statement ALONE is sufficient to answer the question asked.
Questions.opt5: Statements (1) and (2) TOGETHER are NOT sufficient to answer the question asked, and additional data are needed.

Questions.qstn: The measures of the interior angles in a polygon are consecutive integers. The smallest angle measures 136 degrees. How many sides does this polygon have?

If x represents the sum of the interior angles of a regular hexagon and y represents the sum of the interior angles of a regular pentagon, then the difference between x and y is equal to the sum of the interior angles of what geometric shape?
If Polygon X has fewer than 9 sides, how many sides does Polygon X have?
Questions.qstnStmt1: (1)  The sum of the interior angles of Polygon X is divisible by 16.
Questions.qstnStmt2: (2)  The sum of the interior angles of Polygon X is divisible by 15.
Questions.opt1: Statement (1) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (2) alone is not sufficient to answer the question asked.
Questions.opt2: Statement (2) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (1) alone is not sufficient to answer the question asked.
Questions.opt3: BOTH statements (1) and (2) TOGETHER are sufficient to answer the question asked, but NEITHER statement ALONE is sufficient.
Questions.opt4: EACH statement ALONE is sufficient to answer the question asked.
Questions.opt5: Statements (1) and (2) TOGETHER are NOT sufficient to answer the question asked, and additional data are needed.

Questions.qstn: Regular hexagon ABCDEF has a perimeter of 36. O is the center of the hexagon and of circle O. Circles A , B , C , D , E , and F have centers at A , B , C , D , E , and F , respectively. If each circle is tangent to the two circles adjacent to it and to circle O , what is the area of the shaded region (inside the hexagon but outside the circles)?
